Reviews.Title: Nice Package... Junky Pictures
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Atkinson "DadofTwoGirls"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after losing my Canon SD900 while on vaction at Disney World in early December 2008.  As with everything I review, I use an item for several months to truly evaluate how good it is after the "new" purchase feeling has died down and I want to evaluate performance and not emotions for my new toy.This camera is simple to review.  It is very well made.  It is a good looking camera.  You expect big things. But...What you get it is horrible images.  I used it all through the Christmas and New Year holidays (2008) and was disappointed in its pictures.  If this is your first camera in this arena you might not be able to tell and think the images look fine, maybe even great.  However, owning several high end DSLR's, and having used several "point and shoots" as quick grab backups, I can say the images aren't good. They are grainy.  The colors are poor and muted in many instances.  Low light pictures are terrible, bordering on horrendous.  This camera is nowhere near as sharp as my Canon SD900 was and makes me even sadder I lost it.  In the end, aren't the pictures what the camera is all about regardless of the nice construction?  My experience was such that I returned this camera and got a new Canon SD1100 IS which performs as I expect a point and shoot to perform.  Not perfect, but great images for what you are using it for.Pros: Well built with nice construction.  Decent battery life.  Good looking camera.Cons: POOR IMAGES.

Reviews.Title: Nice features, mediocre picture quality
Reviews.Author: Scuba Von
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife to supplement a 4-year-old, bulky Canon A95 digital camera.  First pictures looked okay but seemed to be missing some clarity.  All photos were shot in Auto mode and were taken indoors.  To rate the photo quality, I took photos of the same object with the Nikon and with the old Canon.  I imported the photos onto my laptop and split the screen with the two adjacent images.  I shot the photos in Auto with no zoom.  The results were stunning.  The Nikon photo were fair but not crisp.  On the other hand, the Canon photo was extremely clean and detailed.  We are returning the Nikon and buying another Canon.

Reviews.Title: Good, easy to use!!
Reviews.Author: Ancella Simoes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my Mom as a birthday gift as she wanted something really simple. It's convenient to carry in your purse or pocket and comes with a 5x optical zoom. We have tried clicking group photographs over Christmas as well as shooting videos. Everything came out really well. Got no complaints whatsoever! This model however, doesn't come with an SD card, so buyers will have to buy that seperately.

Reviews.Title: This is a GREAT point & shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Simeone "jblondie813"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! I was a little iffy when buying because of some bad reviews I had read when looking to buy. It ended up being a GREAT purchase! It replaced my Kodak C875 that broke. I took this to Orlando when my husband and I went to Disneyworld and we have a wonderful album full of great pictures! I also take alot of outdoor pictures when I see a beautiful sunset or scenery, and I also take alot of pictures of my doggies. This camera captures great colors! There is alot of extras with this camera, all kinds of different functions, just make sure you read the user manual and it will definitely help you better understand the camera. I love the different settings! If you want to take a picture without the flash in a semi-dark room and you want to capture all of the colors that you are seeing, just put the camera on the "food" setting and it captures absolutely GREAT pictures! Pictures that my Kodak was not capable of.I am very happy with my purchase & I will definitely buy a Nikon again!I will be posting a few sample pictures I have taken with this camera.UPDATE!!It has been a little over a year since I got this camera. I still love it & take very good care of it! It still works as good as the day it shipped to my house!! Definitely a GREAT purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Donald G. Romine "Don"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S560 is all the product I thought it would be.  Sleek, easy to utilize, especially the menu.  The menu is easy to read and navigate.  The numerous photo scene's take excellent pictures for all types of settings.  I would highly recommend this camera and would not hesitate to purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Looks Cool, but Lacks Substance
Reviews.Author: eternalsunshine08
Reviews.Content: As a proud owner of Nikons in the past, I was excited for my new s560 to come in the mail!  But, after taking a few pictures I was shocked by the poor quality of the images.  The colors were dark, and the images appeared grainy.  It's impossible to get good results in low light.  I compared pictures with a sony cybershot, and the difference in the images was unbelievable!  I'm returning this camera immediately.  Perhaps Nikon should stop spending so much money having Ashton Kutcher promote their products, and more money on producing quality cameras!

Reviews.Title: Good little Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: VESP11 "vesp11"
Reviews.Content: Just bought this compact camera for my wife. It is very easy to use and is built very compact. Just testing it out of the box, I have noticed the pictures to be average to good quality. The camera is very fast to recharge after using the flash. Also quick to take a couple of pictures in a row. It is so small it is a little hard to handle for my hands.My wife likes how easy it is to take a picture and it could be in her bag with no real extra weight. If I had one issue the flash is weak while taking a picture of any distance.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: L. Moore
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations. The battery life is without question adequate for a day of picture taking. The option of a second battery is also very welcomed.I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a small camera which is easy to use and produces great pictures. Above all, a camera without the fuss of AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: cool pics from Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Sundog
Reviews.Content: The good: great, sharp lens. Easy to use. Nice featuresThe bad: Short-lived battery. Peripheral shadowing in wide angle view.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Quality Pics
Reviews.Author: Mom of 2
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera in June 2009 before my honeymoon and I HATE it.  It takes terrible pictures.  I'm definitely an amatuer but not an idiot.  Even after 6 years and thousands of pictures, my Sony Cybershot took far better quality pictures with a lot less hassle (until it went kaput).  No matter what setting I try, the flash on the Nikon is wrong (including the auto flash) and the pictures are continually underexposed or overexposed.  The image stabilization is a joke-I have so many blurry pictures of my nieces and nephews that I end up deleting most.  I'm tossing this camera and will not buy a Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Ultra cheap battery door plastic latch makes this inferior product
Reviews.Author: K. Gray "Semi camera savy"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Coolpix S560 on line in June to take on a family trip to Colorado in July. I hadn't used it twice when I noticed the battery lid cover at the bottom of the camera housing wouldn't stay closed! I had removed the battery one time to recharge it, and was careful not to force anything back in where it didn't belong. I was sure to insert the battery into the slot and to place the little orange spring-loaded flange that keeps it down back over the battery properly. So there I was at Rocky Mtn. Nat'l Park asking a park ranger at Alpine visitor center for a rubber band to wrap around the camera housing to keep the dang plastic battery cover closed! In desperation I used the rubber band make-shift "repair" until I got home to contact Nikon repair in New York. After I found out how to ship the camera to them, about 10 days later I got an email response it would cost me around $55 plus shipment back to get this malady repaired. When I wrote back to find out why there would be a charge for what I believed was an obvious design flaw to this camera, their reply was the damage HAD to be from an external force as they had received NO prior reported problems with this camera.  Bull hockey! In a very weak moment, I relented and approved the repair as what other cheaper option did I have? $75 later (did I say I had to pay P/H costs to have it shipped back?). O.K. about a month after first contacting Nikon of this flaw, I had my Coolpix S560 back. Three months later we went on a Caribbean cruise, and guess what? This poor excuse for a camera had the exact same problem occur to its ultra cheapo plastic lip  that is supposed to hold the battery cover down. It doesn't!  Do not waste your money on this or any Nikon camera costing less than $200 is my advice! I am not even going to contact Nikon repair to only receive their same lame excuse for not repairing their cheaply-designed and made Coolpix camera! That would result in me paying more in repairs than what this camera originally cost me this June.P.S.: Guess what, Nikon? A few weeks ago I received an email from another dissatisfied Coolpix customer (after posting my complaint on-line) who had experienced the EXACT same problem with your cheaply made-in-who-knows-where, Nikon camera!

Reviews.Title: Okay, when it works
Reviews.Author: PGMS "PGMS"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter this summer, so it is less than three months old. She turned it on a few days ago and got a "lens error' message. I sent it back to Nikon a week ago and haven't heard from them. This is the second Nikon point-and-shoot I've bought because of their excellent reputation in the SLR world. The other broke after 13 months, and they wanted as much to fix it as I paid for the camera. I will never buy a Nikon point-and-shoot again. I had an inexpensive Kodak for six years, before it ran into problems.

Reviews.Author: Vasil Japaridze
Reviews.Content: great pictures, very light, compact size, amazing display and great quality what else you need?

Reviews.Title: Decent little camera
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for an old canon I had. When I first got it, I was shocked with how bad the pictures were. But then I plugged my memory card into my computer, and the pictures looked three times better than my old canon. So let me say this; you people who review it saying that the pictures look terrible, try plugging it in. I would very strongly recommend this camera to anyone who wants something small, that takes great pictures. The only other thing that I can think of is that the pictures it takes outside are much better than the pictures it takes inside.

Reviews.Title: lens problems
Reviews.Author: Emily L. Uphaus "emme"
Reviews.Content: I had my camera around 8 months when the lens started to have problems. If you do a search this is a common theme among the smaller Nikon cameras. I have to send my camera back to Nikon, but will plan on purchasing a new Cannon as soon as i can.

Reviews.Title: Poor in low light
Reviews.Author: Alison S.
Reviews.Content: I bought the s560 in August and have loved it until recently. I bought it specifically for a trip I was taking out west. I had an older coolpix that I really liked for its ease of use and picture quality, so Nikon was an easy choice. The camera took beautiful pictures of vineyards and mountains and ocean scenes--all on bright sunny days. It wasn't until I tried to take pictures at a friend's wedding that I became disappointed. The mood lighting of the ceremony matched with the measly flash was too much for the camera to handle. All the pictures came out dark despite my close proximity to the altar. Maybe someone with more photography/camera knowledge could monkey with the settings to get a better picture. I tried changing ISO settings to no avail. Other recent indoor events have led to similar dark, disappointing pictures. If you're looking for a great outdoor camera, I would recommend the s560. But, if you want something that does both indoor and outdoor well, I would find something else.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ellis A. Page "Sursee"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great 10 MP camera with loads of features.  For the price it is right.  It's light weight, has a rechargable battery, nice zoom, and really good picture quality.  Night shots are very important to me because I go out with my friends downtown.  This is when I get the most pics on a weekly basis and this camera delivers.  There are a ton of features.  Most of them I will never use, but as long as the pics turn out without grains and without blurring I'm happy.  And thus far I'm very happy with the results.  My last camera was a Kodak Easyshare C813, and the difference it like night and day.  Having had 4 digital cameras from 4 MP up I have to say that this is the best one that I've had.  Great camera in the price range.

Reviews.Title: SUPER CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Wilma "Wilma"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! This is actually the 4th one I have purchased. I have given three of them as gifts and the recipients are thoroughly enjoying them. Easy to use, great pictures, perfect size. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S560
Reviews.Author: Jesse E. Murph
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S560 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom with 2.7 inch LCD (Graphite Black)Really enjoy this camera. It is easy to use and very compact.

Reviews.Title: Too old, not "very good", very slow post.
Reviews.Author: Bai Bin
Reviews.Content: It's too old, the lid of battery can't closed, and it was fixed by someone, one screws losted.Picture looks ok.There is a 2GB SD card in the camera, beyond Description.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for all-around shooting applications
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: We already own an identical camera, and needed a second one, as our two girls fought over who would get to take the camera to summer camp! Buying used was a great way to save money on a camera that we already knew was perfect for our needs. The camera was in better shape that our existing one, in respect to scuffs and overall wear & tear. It came with a fully charged battery and the necessary cables for charging and getting pictures onto computer. All we needed was an SD card for the photo memory storage. Camera performed perfectly for our daughter's camp experience!

Reviews.Title: BUENO
Reviews.Author: Mantias
Reviews.Content: excelente producto, era lo que en realidad estaba esperando, me llego a tiempo, excelente compra, .) :) :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: Stacy Grossman
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift. Should be zero stars. It burns through batteries, but the worst thing by far is that most of the pictures I take are blurry, even with the vibration reduction setting on. I have to take 20 or more pictures of the same thing and hope that I might have one or two that are usable. I have lost images of special memories because they were ruined. Worse than frustrating! Even when I take still pictures (a recipe picture for example) the camera manages to blur the image. I cannot believe that this camera is so awful. Please buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Poor product
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Loney
Reviews.Content: I bought this product, and at a year, the thing died! The lense wouldn't go out on it, and it kept coming up with a lens error. Don't recommend to anyone! And Nikon wouldn't do anything about it, even though it seems to be a known problem.

Reviews.Title: Horrendous Photos
Reviews.Author: Charlie J. Trainer
Reviews.Content: Agree with much written here. This is the worst camera I have ever owned! I bought this to replace a very very good Canon camera that I accidently left on a plane.Low light night time photos with flash are either a total blur or so super lit everyone looks like ghostsI've tried changing the settings; using no flash, night flash, EVERYTHING to no avail!Do NOT buy this camera!!!Saving for another Canon right now!

Reviews.Title: My poor, poor Nikon.
Reviews.Author: SuperAwesome
Reviews.Content: I decided to get this Nikon when we had a baby. At the time I had been relying on my cell and out old digital was a whopping 2.3MP... yeah it had been awhile! Of course I wanted to take millions of pictures of my new baby and share them with my friends and family so this came to live with me. I love it. The pictures are great (in comparison to my parents cameras - panasonics) and up until my baby started walking was perfect. I do find it difficult to capture my daughter while she's on the go (I hear that's common with point and shoots, and why so many moms I know have those pricey, snazzy SLRs!), but that could just be me too.In 2.5 years this poor camera has been dropped countless times - to the point of breaking the battery/card cover latch (mine stays closed with tape now). My toddler drooled on it, chewed on it, pressed on the lens, and even took it for a swim (I think she was going for underwater pictures...). It still works, and it works the same as it always has. My only complaint is the durability of that little door - so just don't drop it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: Easy enough for Grampa
Reviews.Author: pen name "ok?"
Reviews.Content: It's so simple, he produces good pictures and videos without tweaking any settings whether he's outside or in with any sort of lighting.Good choice if you need a simple and consistent camera.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, intuitive design. Flat, washed out pictures
Reviews.Author: D. Hoelck
Reviews.Content: I've owned several budget point-and-shoots like this, and I am well aware of their limitations. I'll compare this to other similar cameras that I've owned.As far as the construction is concerned, it's a sexy, solid device. It's got an enormous LCD display, great optical zoom for a P&S;, and it's small enough to carry comfortably in a pocket or on your wrist.One downside of the design: no viewfinder, so you're stuck with the LCD, which can be really tough to see in direct sunlight.The features aren't great. I'm pretty well versed in Photoshop, so gimmicky features like sepia tone and red-eye reduction aren't things I'd ever use. On the practical side, you can adjust the exposure, manually set the focal point, easily change the flash settings, and set the white point for your shots.I'd trade them all for RAW shooting, but that's just a personal preference that won't effect the casual shooter.The biggest problem is the photos. Sure, it's grainy in low-light, but that's not uncommon. Lighting is something even casual photographers should be aware of, and something professionals or enthusiasts can take years to master. So the grainy low-light photos aren't a dealbreaker for me.The color, however, is abysmal. The camera takes flat, bland photographs, and everything seems to blend together. It also has a really obnoxious tendency to automate everything for you, so two photographs taken at slightly different angles can look completely different, depending on what exposure setting and focal point the camera decided to use. Again, you can set these yourself, but they'll be reset automatically on a fairly regular basis.If you're looking for something for fun snapshots with friends and family, pick up a cheaper model without the frills. If you're looking for a camera that captures high contrast, vibrant images, drop a couple hundred more on a higher end model.Cameras are for capturing images. P&S; models are made for their portability and low price, but the images don't justify the price here.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Quality is lacking with the battery door.  The latch broke on one side of the battery door within a couple months.  Now both tiny plastic latches are broken.  I would not recommend based upon this problem alone.

Reviews.Title: What is this bad review business?
Reviews.Author: Manthony
Reviews.Content: I had my Nikon s560 for two years before I moved on to a newer model.  As with all things you get what you pay for but don't let that fool you.  When I bought my s560 it was a new item and had an attractive price to it.  I have always used slrs but I was looking for something I could take with me when traveling extra light.  Thinking I would only use a point and shoot once or twice a month I was shocked after figuring out it's versatility and quality of images.  Mind you I rarely strayed from 100iso so for all who kept it solely on full auto or on a high isosetting I cannot speak for you, but I was very rarely dissapointed with my photos.  Funny I should buy this inexpensive little point and shoot expecting to only need it maybe once or twice a month where in reality I could never part with it.  It is never going to compare to slr quality but I got more than my money's worth out of the S560 and I make no apologies in celebrating the fact.  The only problems I ever ran into was sometimes my auto focus would second guess itself making macro shots tricky occasionally.  The only reason I stopped using it is I damaged the lens cover when it got hit kind of hard but outside of that it still performs fantastically.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it.
Reviews.Author: chicagopointandshoot
Reviews.Content: While the camera is nice looking with a beautiful LCD and is easy to carry, there are lots of other cameras on the market that offer the same AND take good pictures. The bottom line with the Nikon Coolpix S560 is that it takes fine pictures in bright outdoor lighting, and terrible pictures anywhere else. I've had three Canon Powershot Digital Elph series cameras going back 12 years or so, and they were uniformly terrific. This is my first Nikon and it will certainly be my last.

Reviews.Title: Nikon needs to imporove the point and shoot cameras!
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: For the most part, this camera looks good, quick response and the battery life is great!  But the VR feature is not all that and the over all picture quality needs work. Point and shoot cameras are not made for top notch quality photos but for the money you spend, they should be.  Right?  I want to look into getting the Nikon Coolpix S8000 but read the comments and...poor results with photos.What is it?  Not one point and shoot camera, that I have ever owned, has produced awesome pictures.  I am picky and thank goodness for the DSLRs!I get great results with my D90!  Nikon....rethink the way you make your point and shoot coolpix cameras!  What are you all holding out for?  You all can do better than that!  Consumers are paying big bucks for these devices and we get in return, nothing to write home about!The only reason why I have a point and shoot cool pix is because I can't always have my D90 with me so I need a small purse size shooter! I would just love to have the prefect Coolpix compact camera!  Wouldn't you?It could be a sales tactic.  You buy a camera, don't like it, don't return it and you wait for the next one, buy it, don't like it don't return it or maybe you do.  But the point is...you keep buying and hoping this is the one and it is not.  If you buy one you are satisfied with, no more sales!  Right?  So..you buy and buy and buy.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix review
Reviews.Author: Janis Gagliardo
Reviews.Content: I do like this camera so far because of the bigger screen to look at your subject.  This is the first digital camera that I have had so I'm kindof new at this.  I haven't yet read all the features it has from the instruction book but so far I have been able to take pictures and download them to my computer easily.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S560
Reviews.Author: Charlie Chan
Reviews.Content: Great little camera! Small, lightweight with a large LCD. Takes great pictures.Only drawback is the LCD is flush with the back of the camera body and could be scratched easily...needs a protective covering.

Reviews.Title: Great pics & easy use
Reviews.Author: R. Loso Jr. "Animal lover"
Reviews.Content: I originally had a simpler Coolpix but left it in a rental car while on vacation.  Decided on this model because of features and price and am very happy with the results.  Controls are very intuitive and zoom and memory are excellent. I opted for the camera, case & memory card package, all for under $200!

Reviews.Title: Defective LCD - Worthless Warranty
Reviews.Author: J. Christensen
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera in February. It worked fine until June. Then the LCD became unusable overnight. Sent the camera to the Nikon repair service. They said the LCD was cracked, and this problem is not covered by the warranty. The price they quoted for repair was over $100 including shipping. There was no reason the LCD should have cracked. This had to be a defective camera. The camera now sits on a shelf in my garage together with two spare batteries and a worthless Nikon leather case as a reminder to me that I not buy another Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: absolutely dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Silvana Puppo
Reviews.Content: Im absolutely dissatisfied with the product, i receive it in totally lousy conditions, it comes without the battery, no charger,no memory card, the battery lid was broken and the camera was absolutely scratched and spoiled.I feel very sorry about my purchase becouse frankly was trowing money at trash.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S560
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon S10 too, I like it better.  My S10 has a 10X zoom plus SLR.

Reviews.Title: good intermediate digi
Reviews.Author: Matthew W. Abell
Reviews.Content: Great camera overall, good features, good mega pixels, have used it for 2 months and have no complaints

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Jayakumar Krishnamoor
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera... Lot of noise on the picture and not worth the money.  Returned and got a similar level Samsung, works great!

Reviews.Title: 20$+ overpriced
Reviews.Author: William E. Bell "Bill Bell"
Reviews.Content: The nikon Coolpix S560 is a great camera, but when I checked on other sites afterward I found that it was overpriced on Amazon from 20 to 35 dollars.  Just type in the name and model of the camera on any search engines and view the results.Bill

Reviews.Title: Very fragile screen
Reviews.Author: DR PETE
Reviews.Content: Seemed like a great little camera for 2 weeks  until my wife kept it in her purse during a 2 day trip.. The digital screen cracked and according to the Best Buy salesman it would cost about the same to repair it as to buy a new one--ie we are out $200 because mild pressure  on the screen inside a purse cracked it---a little hard to believe but nothing we can do about it. Had no real chance to evaluate it.

Reviews.Title: coolpix
Reviews.Author: dramamama
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter, and she is thrilled with it.  It takes great pictures and is easy to use.  She wants to be a photographer, so it is a good start with a quality point and shoot before we spend the big bucks on a more professional quality one.

Reviews.Title: Need to read...
Reviews.Author: Vairavan Chandrasekhar "Nikon Lover"
Reviews.Content: It's not at all good. From the zoom side, sound keeps on coming... It is getting zoomed in and out constantly... Sounds makes us more irritated... I am looking for changing this product.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1200
Reviews.Author: John J. Nangle "MrWeekend13"
Reviews.Content: The Canon SD1200 is a sleek high powered pocket camera, that can go anywhere and still take great pictures day or night. It's not complicated to operate and yet if you so desire you can use the camera's manual mode. The lens is a Canon, therefore you can rely on it's quality. I've owned a series of other digitals, but I keep going back to the Canon. This is my third purchase in the SD Series and would definitely recommend this or any Canon Camera. The only downside is the 3x Zoom, that should be higher, and that is why I give it a 4.5 out of 5.
